column4: but it seems nothing I do on the PC is being saved when I restart
I'm using Gnome(Classic) which I'm getting the feeling is no longer supported
Is there a recommended supported interface besides Unity I can use?
Well I'm constantly getting these errors
a few hours, mneptok, but not constant
I installed a few programs, configured Thunderbird and Skype, installed MS fonts
Do you know why it wouldn't save my settings though?
Every time I restart, there's an internal Ubuntu error, my wallpaper is gone
some settings I selected like "Do not show me this message again" go ignored
nicks in IRC get reset for example
It almost sounds like you're running from LiveCD; though I doubt it.
Or, "un-persistant USB"; if there is such a term.
Did you md5sum the Ubuntu ISO, prior to burning it at the SLOWEST speed?
Please see fsck, but ONLY run it on an unmounted file system.
Here, let ubottu provide you with some sound trouble-shooting links.
